meanings.definition: To get in the way of or prevent the progress or success of something.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise from the construction interfered with my ability to concentrate.
meanings.sent2: The storm interfered with our plans for a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel interfered with the bird feeder, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: Her doubts interfered with her dreams, clouding her vision of the future.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog interfered with visibility, making driving dangerous.

meanings.definition: To become involved in a situation when one is not wanted or needed.
meanings.sent1: I didn't mean to interfere, but I couldn't ignore the argument happening next door.
meanings.sent2: Please don't interfere in their personal matters; it will only make things worse.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat decided to interfere with the game of chess, knocking over the pieces.
meanings.sent4: His attempt to interfere in the delicate negotiations only caused more confusion.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected guest's arrival seemed to interfere with the carefully planned party.

meanings.definition: To tamper or meddle with something.
meanings.sent1: It's not a good idea to interfere with the delicate machinery without proper training.
meanings.sent2: The children were warned not to interfere with the experiment set up in the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon managed to interfere with the neatly arranged garbage cans.
meanings.sent4: She accidentally interfered with the radio settings and couldn't find her favorite station.
meanings.sent5: The hacker attempted to interfere with the company's website, but was caught by security measures.
